name: Renaissance Los Angeles Airport Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night before an early departure from LAX. The Hotel is easy to find and less than 5 minutes from Departure Terminals at LAX. It is part of the Marriott Chain which I like to use whenever possible. It is a beautiful Hotel, very nicely appointed. The check-in desk clerk was very hasty and not overly friendly, but the concierge made up for it. They were very helpful with questions etc.
reviews.title: Great LAX Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were average size, the beds were wonderful pillow tops and very comfortable. The bathroom was good size with nice amenities. There was a small fridge in the room as well.
reviews.title: Perfect flight recovery!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Airport Shuttle was very convenient, it runs continuously 24 hours every 15minutes. No reservations are required, just proceed outside and catch the next bus.
reviews.title: Great value for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would certainly stay here again for the convenience to the airport. It is also very close to the rental car drop-off locations.
reviews.title: The best hotel bed I've ever slept in!

likes.disliked: — Rooms were a little on the small side

reviews.text: We stayed here on our first night in the USA, as we didn't want to venture far in the rental car on our first night. The location was perfect, very close to the airport, and just one block from the Dollar Rent a car site where we had just picked up our car.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.text: I can highly recommend the Renaissance Montura. After the horrendous experience of LAX Airport I was in need of somewhere to relax and was so happy to get to the hotel. The Renaissance is only a few minutes from the aiport and the shuttle service picks you up right outside the baggage claim area. The hotel is quiet (even though it is close to the airport) and classy. The rooms are large, clean and very tastefully furnished. The restaurant food was excellent with a great breakfast buffet. Front Desk staff were extremely professional, friendly and very helpful.
reviews.title: Airport Oasis

reviews.text: Very nice hotel close to LAX
reviews.title: Good Lax hotel

reviews.text: Room was very clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a Terrible Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Becareful of the nickel and dime expences (parking, internet, water, etc), we got a pkg with parking incl.
reviews.title: Great Stop-Over Hotel

likes.liked: — Great value close to the airport.

reviews.text: One nice thing was an empty fridge (they will fill for you if you want) instead of a minibar.
reviews.title: Convenient place for a lay-over

likes.liked: — Proximity to the airport for connecting flights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent the President's Day weekend at the Montura. Got a very reasonable rate of $119 from their website. The hotel is above average in most respects. The valet was quick and courteous. Front desk check-in was smooth. The room was spic and span. I requested and got a high floor with a view of the LAX runways. The room was very quiet even with planes taking off and landing most of the day. I would not hesitate staying at this property again.
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the Rennaissance after a quick trip from to Boston to visit our daughter who goes to college in CA. We needed a hotel to stay at near the airport as our flight out was leaving at 7 AM. I read the reviews of all the hotels near LAX in TripAdvisor and chose the Renaissance based on the feedback. We were not disappointed. The hotel was convenient, clean, and very, very quiet. We felt like the only guests in our part of the hotel. It might even have been a bit creepy, if I was traveling alone on business. But that does not take away from the well-appointed room, and the absolutely divine bed and linens. The pillow-top bed with the soft cotton sheets and duvet were bliss. I dreaded having to get up early to leave as I wanted to luxuriate in the linens all day! The windowpanes must have been tripled-paned, as we could watch the planes land, but did not hear even a slight engine noise. The registration staff was competent, but not overly friendly. The early morning (5 AM) coffee and continental staff were kind, given the early hour. It was nice to be able to grab a cup of Peet's coffee before having to face LAX. The shuttle was on time and one can track its progress with their touch screen kiosk in the lobby. It certainly eased our "getting to the airport" on time anxieties. Once you are on the shuttle the automated voice even tells you how long it will be until you get to the airport. Nice touch.
reviews.title: Nice hotel near LAX
Perfect for airport layover
reviews.text: All in all, I would highly recommend the Rennaissance for overnight travelers who need quick access to the airport. I am not sure I would make it my first destination option if it was my first trip to LA. The area around the hotel is asphalt, car rental agencies, and industrial complexes. Pretty grim. But for an overnight, it is ideal.

I bid on priceline.com and paid only $116 (including tax) for one night in this 4-star hotel. It was definitely worth it. It is a true 4-star hotel with all the style, comfort, and space. I asked for a room with double beds, but the hotel clerk told me that they ran out of such rooms and upgraded me to a room with a living area, and a pull-out sofa. It has plenty of desk and storage space, a large bathroom, two TVs, and a king-size bed. My mom and I had a very restful night between flights. Though it was near the airport, we couldn't hear the airplanes at all when inside the room. It doesn't feel like an airport hotel at all. There is a Burger King right across the street, so you can save money on food if you don't mind fast food for one day (we didn't.)
reviews.title: Very nice airport hotel

likes.liked: — Space and comfort, close to airport, free shuttle service

reviews.text: We chose to stay here even though we weren't flying in an out of LAX. We got a nice rate for a great hotel, especially when comparing what the rates were going for with similar class hotels in other areas of L.A. Staff were friendly and quick during check-in. Self parking was included in our rate and was pretty easy breezy. The room was nicely appointed, with nice bed linens, marble counter-tops, and a flat screen tv. I was mostly impressed that we could not hear the airplanes at all. The room was nice and silent! We would not hesitate to say here again in the future.
reviews.title: Nice option in a central spot

likes.liked: — Nice hotel which is located in a good central spot in the L.A. area
likes.disliked: — Wish there were more reasonable dining options within walking distance

reviews.text: Stayed at the LAX Renaissance as a quick place to stay after arriving late into LAX at the start of our trip.
reviews.title: Good and Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, if you arrive late (after 11pm), their shuttle hardly ever shows up. We waited in the exhaust fumes for 30 mins before calling the hotel. All of the other hotel shuttles arrived - just not ours.
reviews.title: Nice but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we called, they told us to book a cab and they would reimburse. Cab fare was $20 with tip. I asked the Cabbie when we got in if he took credit cards. He said "yep". When we arrived, he told me he did not take credit cards, and pointed to the ATM in the hotel lobby.
reviews.title: Thoughtful Staff, Great Food, Loved it!

likes.liked: — Rooms were very comfortable, great food, staff was amazing.
likes.disliked: — Didn't tell us about daily room deposits that would have to be made at check-in.

reviews.text: We booked here thru a Marriott promotional rate ($89/night) for a layover at LAX. The shuttle was prompt. Rooms were surprisingly pleasant for an airport hotel. Our room faced the runways (evidently that was a prime location for the nightime view) and the windows were so well sealed, we didn't hear a thing. We didn't have a car and the concierge helpfully directed us to a free shuttle a block away that went to Manhattan Beach (the beach and to a mall there). It was a great way to pass a long afternoon. The hotel restaurant (we ate in the "coffee shop") was very pretty, had a decent selection and the food was done nicely (not amazing but good for being at the airport). Yuo got the feeling that the hotel staff really did want you to enjoy your stay, even if it was a short one. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Good location and very nicely done rooms near LAX

likes.liked: — Location, value and quality of facility

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here at the start of our holiday! We only stayed for two nights while we got over any jet lag.
reviews.title: Great start!

likes.disliked: — It was having some refurbishment to the lobby

reviews.text: Its a really nice clean hotel and a very short drive from the airport. We stayed for 2 nights, which due to the hotels location, is about enough really, as there are nicer areas to stay for a holiday.
reviews.title: Very comfy bed
Far Better Then I ever Expected! Highly Recommend
reviews.text: We had to pay for parking our hire car, which was something we hadn't really thought about.

We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Very close to LAX just a short taxi journey. We had booked a non smoking twin room but on arrival this was not available so we were offered an up grade to a king size suite. As I was travelling with a friend we didn’t mind crashing in the same bed but might be a different story if you are away on business! The bed was huge and so comfy and the room was sound proof from the noise of the road and airport. There were complimentary bottles of water in the room and luxurious toiletries, which was a nice touch. The hotel runs a shuttle bus (which looks like a red tram) runs down to Manhattan Beach and to a local shopping mall which we would have never had known was so close by. The driver of the bus was very helpful and friendly. The bus runs every hour after 10.30. This hotel is fine for a short stay. We did not use the pool, go to the beach instead. There is a fantastic place for breakfast near the shore called Uncle Bills Pancake house. Well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

reviews.text: There appears to alot of convetion space here if needed, excersize room, pool (small / 4Ft deep max), and a well appointed lobby to just hang and watch the world go by.
reviews.title: good as an airport hotel, less good for long stays1

reviews.text: The Freeway (I-405) is minutes away with good signes to direct you where to go. I will defintely stay there again when in town.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Very Nice!!!
No great deal!
reviews.text: We stayed here when we needed a hotel for one night near LAX. It was really a surprisingly nice hotel. Very comfortable. Very quiet. Nice facilities (but tiny pool). I would definitely recommend this to anyone needing a first class hotel near LAX, and I would definitely stay here again.
I stayed at the Renaissance Montura during a layover at LAX. I booked the room for $99/ night on Priceline and what a great deal!
reviews.title: Great LAX Hotel

likes.disliked: — The decor is a little cluttered for my taste.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luckily, the free shuttle van was waiting just outside of baggage claim when I got outside. The van was full, but comfortable. It stops at the Marriott first and then the Renaissance. The driver was very helpful with luggage.
reviews.title: would definitely return

likes.liked: — beauty of the hotel interior, room, food, convenience to the airport

reviews.text: Check-in was speedy and friendly. I do love that they still give you Marriott points even when you buy on Priceline. They had all of my requests in the reservations and were able to accommodate (high floor, away from elevator, etc.)
reviews.title: Heaven After A Sleepless Trans-Pacific Flight!

likes.liked: — Great service, comfortable bed, quiet rooms

reviews.text: The lobby and property all look new and well maintained. It is funny...the decor is a just a touch over the top and cluttered...but it is pretty. The bar and restaurant area are nice looking and clean.
reviews.title: Pity about the shuttle ...

likes.liked: — Comfy bed, good sound insulation, room upgrade

reviews.text: The room was very big. As you can see in the picture...you are right at the airport and on a major street...but there was ZERO noise. There is not a lot of late night dining options within walking distance. However, the late night menu was good and the prices were reasonable. The big bottles of Fiji water are only $4.50 which is actually a good price for hotel water these days!
reviews.title: Only a quick stay, but one of the best parts of my trip
Nice place to stay
reviews.text: Great place to stay, A & J October 17th, 2006, PA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here one night after a long flight home from Fiji. Our
reviews.title: Fine stay at the Renaissance

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights and was very impressed overall. Was upgraded to the club floor (MR Gold). The Club Lounge was one of the few in the US that is open on the weekend! Breakfast, evening snacks, and dessert were all outstanding, different each day, and amazingly free of any fried food typical of lounge snacks. Room was quiet, large, and clean. The temperature, however, was difficult to control--either too hot or too cold, and the AC was noisy. Excercise room had good equipment and individual TV's. The LAX transit center is a five minute walk to the hotel; from there, you can catch public transit to downtown. For IN-and-Out Burger fans, there is one within a 15 min walk on Sepulveda. Hotel shuttle runs continuously to and from LAX and was very efficient. Would definitely stay at the Montura again.
reviews.title: Excellent LAX Hotel

reviews.text: The Renaissance Montura is located conveniently very close to LAX - we picked this hotel for the convenience of the location, the competitive rates and because everything was booked where we needed to stay.
reviews.title: Not bad for an airport hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night in preparation for our flight the next day out of LAX. We stayed on the club floor at a tune of $259 per night. Afternoon hor doeuvres were not plentiful. Watch out for the seniors staying on the club floor; they ate everything in site making a meal with the hor doeuvres leaving nothing for simple folks like ourselves who are not used to fight for food in a club lounge. Breakfast was the same chaotic manner with the seniors fighting for the club lounge food...it was a sight to see.
reviews.title: The Club Floor ain't worth it!!!

likes.disliked: — seniors in the club lounge eating everything in sight!!!

reviews.text: Nice beds, outdated bathroom with faucets the oldest that I have ever seen. Free internet in the club lounge with free printing-nice!
reviews.title: Great Business Hotel

reviews.text: Airport shuttle stops at the Marriott first so if the bus is full it simply passes by the Renaissance without picking anyone up and you have to wait again.
reviews.title: Nice for airport hotel

reviews.text: Suggestion for future travelers...simply try to avoid landing and taking off from LAX...not too much choice for luxury hotels in the LAX area.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in LAX Area
This is well worth staying at
reviews.text: Despite pratically being on the runway, the plane noise is not bad at all, and I am sensitive to noise.

The one thing that is a pity they have not addressed is the air conditioning which is very boisterous and noisy, and I have found that I need to leave it off when going to bed at night and so in summer the rooms get hot and bit uncomfortable over night.
reviews.title: Convenient for LAX

reviews.text: The other area that is not great is the bar and dining facilities. The bar is small and not that exciting and the food is pretty average and limited. So while this is fine when there for a night or maybe two, if you stay any longer then you tire of the food. The problem being that as this is a hotel airport there is nowhere to pop out and walk to for an alterative meal.
reviews.title: Excellence!

aka: Renaissance Montura Los Angeles Hotel Los Angeles
